title: Social Problem-Solving Workshop Utilizing Experiential Information Processing Learning Model

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment combining smartphone-based activities and offline field investigations. Implements experiential learning scenarios focused on solving community issues.

learning_goals: Learners can explain a three-stage information-processing cycle—analyzing, applying, and reflecting on the causes of social phenomena—through experiential learning models
Learners can collect and analyze community issue data using smartphone-based survey tools and propose solutions
Learners can reflect on insights gained during experiential learning and document them in reflective reports through peer feedback and self-assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
